meta.title: Warden System Glossary
meta.description: Domain-bounded semantic definitions for zero-knowledge system taxonomy.

terms.definition: A high-level strategic outcome registered in goals.json. It represents the terminal state or desired result of system evolution.
A governed instance of execution (Protocol Cycle) designed to satisfy a specific subset of a Goal.
terms.context_usage: Each mission must be initialized via warden.js init.

terms.definition: A formal deliverable contract between Engineer and Director, defining the tactical approach for a Mission.
terms.context_usage: DLR_GSD_PLAN is the output of Phase 2.

terms.definition: The specific technical or procedural target of a Mission. It serves as both a concept (the destination) and a data field (the plan definition).
terms.context_usage: 1. Conceptual: 'The Objective of this Mission is refactoring.' 2. Data: 'Update the Objective field in GSD_PLAN.'

terms.definition: A codified set of best practices or technical constraints (e.g., STD_FILE_CONSOLIDATION) that must be applied to an Objective.
terms.context_usage: All implementation must adhere to the Tool Pathing Standard.

terms.definition: A standardized JSON representation of a CLI command, used to eliminate semantic ambiguity in audit logs.
terms.context_usage: Every execution must be mapped to a Canonical Intent.

terms.definition: The component within Warden that resolves raw shell strings into structured objects using metadata patterns.
terms.context_usage: The Intent Dispatcher intercepted the command.

terms.definition: Any system-level command executed through the governance proxy that does not map to a recognized canonical intent.
terms.context_usage: A Shadow Action was logged due to a missing intent pattern.
